Dear Ms. Knodel:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry.
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation ALLEGATION 1: On 02/17/2025, staff member threw away
youth’s food, but he was able to eat other food. Staff said that he
thought it was old when the food was still hot. Staff also pointed a
knife at this youth, but the knife did not make contact with his
body.
ALLEGATION 2: On 02/19/2025, same staff threatened youth and
said, "I'll slice your ass," but he did not actually slice him. Staff is
going to be fired, but it is unknown if he will have contact with
youth before he is fired. No further details are known.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on 2/19/25 &
3/3/25 via telephone and via email in conjunction with MDHHS
Worker. In addition to the allegations reported, she reported that
Independent Living Youth A’s (ILY A) legal status is an
2

unaccompanied refugee minor. FCW reported she did not have
any concerns regarding ILY A’s placement currently. However,
she provided information from ILY A’s home country of Sudan.
She reported he experienced violence (resulting in his refugee
status) and that he lost contact with his parents.
FCW reported becoming aware of both incidents within 24 hours.
She said ILY A reported Staff 1 threw his food away on 2/18/25
around 4:00 pm because the food had been sitting for a while and
had bugs flying around it. She said ILY A said this was not true.
She said she believes the food being thrown away was a one-time
occurrence. FCW said ILY A sent her the video of the second
incident involving the recording of Staff 1 speaking to ILY A and
using “colorful language” at 3:00 am on 2/19/25. FCW denied any
prior concerns with Staff 1. FCW reported that ILY A said that
Staff 1 pointed a knife at him, but it did not touch him, and he was
not harmed.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed on 2/19/25, via
telephone. She provided this Consultant with the contact
information for staff involved with the allegations. She had no
additional information to add.
Independent Living Youth A (ILY A) was interviewed on
2/21/25, via video conference with an interpreter, FCW, and
MDHHS Worker. ILY A was forensically interviewed by MDHHS
Worker who was the lead interviewer. ILY A only speaks Arabic.
ILY A reported Staff 1 told all of the youth that they did not
deserve to eat because they are refugees. ILY A was asked if he
or any other youth have gone hungry or missed any meals while
at Holy Cross. ILY A said there was one day the kitchen did not
have any groceries, and he asked Staff 1 if he could take him and
the other youth to get groceries. Staff 1 denied the request. ILY A
said he made whatever he could that night to eat but Staff 1 threw
his food in the trash because Staff 1 is not a rational person and a
racist. ILY A said he was hungry this day. ILY A was asked if he
told any staff members about the food incident. ILY A said he
informed all of the other staff who works the afternoon shift
including Program Manager who is the supervisor of Staff 1. He
said nobody did anything. ILY A said sometimes staff would close
the kitchen at night and as a result he went hungry. ILY A was not
sure why staff closed the kitchen as punishment. ILY A disclosed
that he also has to wash the dishes even if they are not his own.
ILY A reported he did not feel safe at Holy Cross. ILY A was
asked if Staff 1 said any racial slurs to him or other youth. ILY A
3

said the only thing Staff 1 said that was racist is “we did not
deserve to eat because you are only refugees.”
ILY A reported he does not know the staff member’s name, but he
refers to him as “Bro.” He reported he was still very angry at the
staff for throwing his food away. ILY A said it all started when he
was in the kitchen late afternoon cooking on 2/18/25, and he
asked Staff 1 for a knife. He said Staff 1 grabbed a kitchen knife
and threatened him with it. He said Staff 1 did not touch him with
the knife. He said he was not sure why Staff 1 threatened him
and that he did nothing to provoke Staff 1 and all he did was ask
Staff 1 for a knife. He said Staff 1 told him; he would kill him. He
said he left the kitchen because he wanted to get Staff 1 on tape.
He said he went to his room, got his phone, went to the staff office
because he wanted to videotape the conversation between him
and Staff 1. ILY A said there were no witnesses to this incident in
the kitchen.
ILY A was asked if there were any other incidents at Holy Cross
that made him feel unsafe or uncomfortable and ILY A said no that
was all.
Independent Living Youth B (ILY B) was interviewed on
2/26/25, with MDHHS Worker via telephone. He reported he
was in the building the night the incident occurred, and Staff 1 was
on staff. ILY B said food was thrown away because flies were in
the kitchen and got into ILY A food because the food was not
covered. ILY B reported all five of the youths were involved in the
incident because they eat late at night. ILY B reported the youth
always make a mess in the kitchen and they do not clean up after
themselves. ILY B reported the youth had already eaten once and
was going to eat again. ILY B said the youth would have gotten
sick if they ate old food that had flies on it. He reported if the food
is left out, staff will throw the food out. ILY B stated Staff 1 is a
nice man and he never made a threat towards any of the youths to
his knowledge.
ILY B reported Staff 1 found a knife that one of the youths had in
their room when the room was cleaned after the youth had left
Holy Cross. ILY B reported Staff 1 did not know which youth had
the knife. He said he knew this information because he overheard
staff talking about it amongst themselves.
ILY B said he never heard of any staff making threats towards
any of the youths in the program. He reported all knifes are
locked up and that staff never used any knife to threaten youths.
4

ILY B ended the interview by stating the youths wanted to kill Staff
1. He said they did not respect Staff 1 because he gave the all
youths in the program directions. ILY B reported the youths would
throw trash cans at staff members if they did not like a direction
given to them, and the youths would always travel in groups and
would approach any situation with four or five youth to fight each
other or staff. He said if ILY A had a problem, it became the other
youth’s problem as well because ILY A was the leader.
Independent Living Youth C (ILY C) was interviewed on
2/26/25, via telephone with MDHHS Worker. He reported there
is always food in the house. He said the youths get a lot of food
that lasts for a week. He said staff take them to get food weekly.
He said there are no issues of staff not wanting to take them to the
stores. ILY C reported the youths would complain there was no
food in the house, and they would then call the police to make a
complaint. ILY C said staff would take them to the stores but as
soon as they get into the stores, they would make a scene
amongst themselves.
ILY C said the only food that was thrown out was food that had
been left out for hours because it was “nasty”. He said food that
had been left out had gnats flying over it and the food did not have
any lids covering the food. He reported he came downstairs on
the day of the incident, and he saw Staff 1 throw the food out. He
said gnats were flying over the food. He said no one was eating
the food and the food was left unattended.
ILY C reported a butter knife was found in one of the youths
rooms when they left, and their rooms were cleaned. He said he
has one but, his knife is locked up in the staff office. He reported
he was threatened once by ILY A. He said he was told to get out
of their business or else. He reported he understood that the
youths grew up in an intimidating environment and feels they
always had to work in a group to feel safe and to protect
themselves. He reported however, it’s the youths who are always
threatening each other in the house as well as staff members. He
reported at no time has he ever witnessed Staff 1 or any of the
staff members threaten any youth with a knife.
IL Youth D (ILY D) was interviewed on 3/10/25, via telephone
and face-to-face with MDHHS Worker and an interpreter. ILY
D is an unaccompanied refugee minor court ward placed in the
care and custody of Bethany Christian Services through MDHHS.
He reported the youth in the program could use the kitchen
5

anytime during the day but at nighttime the youth could only cook
during certain times, and they had to be finished by midnight. He
reported the youths were in charge of cleaning the kitchen after
they finished cooking. He said sometimes the youths would clean
the kitchen and sometimes they would not clean the kitchen, and it
would get dirty. He reported if staff asked them to clean the
kitchen, they would decide if they wanted to clean it or not. Most
times, they would not clean it if staff asked them too. ILY D said
he only knew of the incident regarding a knife by hearing it from
ILY A. He said he did not witness this incident. ILY D said Staff 1
did tell them to clean the kitchen up before he threw out the food.
He said no bugs was in the kitchen. ILY D said ILY A did not
share the video with him but that he learned that ILY A had a
video of Staff 1 talking to him in a bad way. He reported the only
time Staff 1 threatened the youth was telling them he would not
take them to the market to buy food. ILY D said most of the
information came to him from ILY A.
Staff 1 was interviewed with MDHHS Worker on 2/28/25, via
telephone conference. He reported he had a few verbal
altercations with youth but that he never tried to hurt any of the
youth in his care. He reported he was off for four days and when
he returned, he could not understand why the house was so dirty.
He said he was working with Staff 2 and there were 14 youths in
the building. He reported trash was everywhere in the house. He
said the youth are supposed to clean but he started cleaning the
house around 9:30pm. He said ILY A and others are usually
finished eating around 8:PM or 9:00PM. Staff 1 said he went into
the kitchen and noticed a skillet on the stove with old rice and
some kind of old meat. He said the food had been eaten earlier
that day and gnats were flying everywhere. He said he had
observed ILY A in the kitchen earlier, so he went to his room and
translated through his phone and asked ILY A to come downstairs
with him. He said ILY A said no. Staff 1 said he wanted to show
ILY A the gnats that was flying around the food and to let him
know that he was throwing the food out. He said afterwards, he
went back to the kitchen and dumped the food out, cleaned the
kitchen and left his shift for that day. He said he does not know
which one of the youths went to the kitchen after he left but, the
next day when he came to work, he was informed that he threw
the youths food out on purpose and that a grievance was filed on
him. He said at this point; he was not under an investigation. He
denied throwing the food out on purpose.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was in the kitchen that day and shared
with him how the youth had poured grease in the sink and how the
6

sink was clogged. Staff 1 said Staff 2 told him that he had a better
rapport with ILY A and she wanted Staff 1 to go to ILY A room to
let him see the sink and to ask him to unclog the sink and to clean
up the mess. He said he did not go to ILY A’s room but unclogged
the sink himself because he knew ILY A would not do this.
Staff 1 reported in regard to the knife situation, he denied pointing
a knife at ILY A and said he has no idea where this information
came from. He reported he would never point a knife at any of the
youths.
Program Manager (PM) was interviewed on 2/26/25, with
MDHHS Worker. He reported on 2/13/25 it was alleged the
youths were making vegetable soup in the kitchen. They were
asked by Staff 1 to clean the vegetables out of the sink, and they
refused to do so. Staff 1 responded by throwing their pot of soup
in the trash before they had a chance to eat it. PM reported ILY A
reported on 2/19/2025, that Staff 1 made inappropriate and
threatening comments to him when he confronted Staff 1 for
throwing away their soup. PM reported he watched the video
taping of the incident and afterwards, he sent the video clippings
to Director of Quality and Compliance.
PM provided the agency a video recording to watch of the incident
to MDHHS Worker and this Consultant.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 3/11/25, via telephone with MDHHS
Worker. She reported she was working on the day of the incident
with Staff 1. She reported she went to the kitchen because the
sink was clogged, and she then went upstairs to ILY A room to
ask him to go downstairs and unclog the sink. She reported lots
of water was over the sink because the youths were pouring
grease down the sink. She said she knew the last person in the
kitchen cooking was ILY A. She said she was unaware of the
food being thrown out and that ILY A did not discuss this with her,
nor did he go downstairs to unclog the sink. She said he told her
that was her job. Staff 2 reported the youths ate all day and
cooked 4 times per day, and they never cleaned up after
themselves. She said the youths would tell staff they don't clean
up. The youths would go in and cook and leave the kitchen a
mess.
Staff 2 reported she is not aware of Staff 1 ever confronting the
youths. She has never noticed Staff 1 getting irritated with the
youths for not cleaning up. Staff 2 reported she is not aware of
any time the youths didn't have any food in the house and only ate
7

fruit. Staff 2 replied, "They always had food” and foster care
always ensures they have food. Staff 2 reported foster care will do
online orders for the youths and she will pick up the order from
Walmart.
Staff 2 confirmed staff lock up the cooking knives. She said there
were no issues with the youths not bringing the knives back when
they were done. She said she has never been threatened with a
knife and has never heard of any issues with a knife.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 3/14/25, via telephone with MDHHS
Worker. She reported she came into work at 11:00pm the night
of the first incident involving the food being thrown out by Staff 1.
She said she came in for 3rd shift to the youths wanting to see the
camera footage. She reported she did not allow the youths to view
the footage. She said she viewed the footage and saw Staff 1
throwing the youths dinner away. Staff 3 said she believes the
youths were waiting for the food to cool down, which she noted is
not uncommon for their culture. Staff 3 reported the youths were
so upset they hung around the office from 11:00pm-4:00am
asking to watch the video footage. She said the youth still had
access to food but were upset because they had already prepared
food to eat. She reported she knows there were dirty dishes in the
sink when she arrived. She was told by Staff 1 that he told the
youths to clean up prior to throwing the food away, but she never
saw footage supporting this claim. Staff 3 reported she did not
hear any audio regarding Staff 1 asking the youths to clean up.
She reported Staff 1 also indicated there were bugs in the food,
but she personally cleaned the kitchen the day prior, so the food
would not have been on the stove since the night prior. She
reported she saw the food being prepared by ILY A via watching
the video footage. Staff 3 said she did not see Staff 1 asking the
youths to clean up, but one of the youths admitted to her that Staff
1 asked them to clean up and they admitted they refused. Staff 3
reported when she arrived at 11:00pm, she could smell that food
had been cooked, so Staff 1 should have known the food was
prepared recently.
Staff 3 reported the youths typically would put their dirty dishes in
the sink, but didn't always complete the cleaning process. She
reported when the youths were told to clean, the youths would
say, "You clean it." She said none of them said this to her, but
she heard this was the common response to other staff. She also
directly heard a youth say this to another staff when they asked
the youth to clean.
8

Staff 3 reported ILY A wanted a knife and did not want to ask Staff
1. ILY A referenced his picture and said, "This man is a bad, bad
man, and we do not want to talk to him." In response, since Staff 1
was in the staff office where the knives were, Staff 3 said she
walked with ILY A to the office and asked Staff 1 for a knife. Staff
1 gave the cooking knife to Staff 3 who handed the knife to ILY A.
ILY A held the knife and pointed it in Staff 1's direction and said
something indistinguishable. Staff 3 reported it happened so
quickly, she cannot recall details and does not remember exactly
how the knife was pointed. She said she is confident whatever ILY
A said was directed at Staff 1.
Staff 3 summed up her interview by stating, she worked with Staff
1 at another Holy Cross location, and she has never heard of any
issues with his performance or the way he treats the youths. She
said Staff 1 does his job well, so she was really surprised by the
incident of him throwing the food away.
Director of Quality & Compliance was interviewed on 3/27/25,
via phone with MDHHS Worker. She reported she was going to
do an investigation when he threw away the youth’s soup to see
why and what happened because she viewed the video, the
youths complained about it, rightfully so, and in her opinion Staff 1
escalated the youths. She reported Staff 1 was on a performance
improvement plan (PIP) related to an incident in the past
regarding escalating behavior of youths with how Staff 1 has
responded to situations which is what happened in this situation.
Director of Human Resources was contacted via email on
3/27/25. She provided detailed information of Staff 1’s personnel
file. This information will be discussed in documents reviewed
section.
ALLEGATION 2:
All staff and youths were interviewed by MDHHS Worker and this
Consultant. It is noted that the youths were interviewed with an
interpreter.
FCW reported she received a video recording from ILY A on
2/19/25, around 3:00am. She reported ILY A had recorded a
video of Staff 1 using threatening and inappropriate language
towards ILY A. She said when she heard the statements on the
recorder, she acted accordingly, filed a complaint and notified her
administration. FCW reported she later talked with ILY A about
the recording, and he told her that he wanted to get this staff on
video recording because he felt other staff would not believe him.
9

FCW said ILY A reported this was an isolated incident and this
type of behavior from staff members does not usually occur.
ILY A reported that he does not know the staff member name, but
he refers to him as “Bro.” He reported he was still very angry at
the staff for throwing his food away. ILY A said it all started when
he was in the kitchen late afternoon cooking on 2/18/25, and he
asked Staff 1 for a knife. He said Staff 1 grabbed a kitchen knife
and threatened him with it. He said Staff 1 did not touch him with
the knife. He said he was not sure why Staff 1 threatened him
and that he did nothing to provoke Staff 1 and all he did was ask
Staff 1 for a knife. He said Staff 1 told him he would kill him. He
said he left the kitchen because he wanted to get Staff 1 on tape.
He said he went to his room, got his phone, went to the staff office
because he wanted to videotape the conversation between him
and Staff 1. ILY A said there were no witnesses to this incident in
the kitchen.
ILY A presented his phone to MDHHS Worker, this Consultant
and FCW. This video recording was also viewed on camera at the
agency by the MDHHS Worker and this Consultant. It can be
heard ILY A state to Staff 1, repeat what you said to me. Staff 1
stated, “you wanna play with me? Don’t play with me, get the fuck
out of here before I kill your ass, I will slice your shit, stop playing
with me, don’t ever threaten me, I never did anything to your
motherfucking ass.” ILY A was asked if there were any other
incidents at Holy Cross that made him feel unsafe or
uncomfortable. ILY A said no, that was all.
Staff 1 reported he did not know where the knife came from and
that he did not have a knife threatening ILY A. He reported that all
knifes are secure in the staff office. He said he is not sure if the
youth in the program have knifes because staff does not search
the youths or their bedrooms. He reported on this particular day
ILY A ask him for a knife, he was busy and that he put his hand up
to ask ILY A to wait a minute. He said ILY A went and got Staff 3.
He said Staff 3 got the knife and gave it to ILY A. He reported
when ILY A got the knife, he pointed the knife at Staff 3 and said,
“Bitch I will get you.” He said he asked Staff 3 what was that all
about and Staff 3 said she did not know. Staff 1 reported ten or
fifteen minutes went by, he went to the kitchen to throw away
trash and ILY A pointed the knife at him, (Staff 1) and was “Trash
talking and being disrespecting towards him.”. He reported he
could not remember his exact words he made towards ILY A but
he does not remember using cuss words towards ILY A. MDHHS
Worker repeated what was heard on ILY A’s telephone that was
10

said by Staff 1. Staff 1 denied swearing at ILY A stating he could
not recall what he said and that ILY A “was out to get him.” Staff 1
said he did not have anything against the youths and after the
altercation, he tried to apologize and make peace with ILY A.
Staff 1 reported all of the staff tried to get along with the youths
but that they all followed ILY A who was the leader of the group
and whatever he said or did, the other four youths followed his
directions, and it was always negative.
Staff 1 reported and admitted that he allowed his frustration to get
the better of him. He continued by stating he has worked for the
agency for four years, been very faithful and now his career is
ruined. He said he has had no altercations with youths or in any
way tried to hurt a youth.
Director of Quality & Compliance was interviewed on 3/27/25,
via phone with MDHHS Worker. She reported she had her
interviews arranged for the investigation but she received the
email regarding the recording the youths sent their foster care
worker, listened to the audio of the incident, and decided not to
interview all those that she planned to interview because the
recommendation was to terminate him as he clearly violated the
agency policy related to Participant Safety and Well Being that is
proved by the audio recording. She reported she will work with
the Human Resource Director to identify additional information
regarding Staff 1’s behaviors with youths in the past.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
• Agency camera video of the incident between ILY A and
Staff 1 that occurred on 2/18/25. The video did not show
Staff 1 with a knife pointing it towards Staff 1. The video
did show Staff 1 entering the kitchen, throwing food away.
The video did not show any files or gnats circling around
the food. There were several agency video clippings
watched of the incident. The agency video recording did not
have sound. The agency video did not show any physical
contact between ILY A and Staff 1. A summary of the
agency video clippings is as following:
Clippings 1 & 2 the video at 22:38:19 show ILY A prepping
food in the kitchen. Staff 1 walks into the kitchen, stands at
the counter where ILY A is prepping food and is saying
something to ILY A until 22:38:29, Staff 1 walks out and ILY
A remains in the kitchen. At 22:38:22 Staff 1 walks out of
the kitchen and goes into the staff office.
Clippings 3 & 4. 22:39:06 ILY A exits the kitchen area and
approaches the staff office in the dining room area. ILY A is
11

holding the butcher knife, he was using in the kitchen in his
right hand, and his hand is down next to his side while
talking to Staff 1. While ILY A is talking to Staff 1, he moves
his left hand to express his feelings, but his right hand
remains by his side. It does not appear he ever lifts the
knife and point it toward Staff 1. ILY A walks away from
the office and back into the kitchen at 22:40:00. At
22:28:57 Staff 2 gives a cutting knife with a blue handle to
ILY A. ILY D is with ILY A when ILY A is given the knife.
ILY B is sorting through his groceries in the dining area
while the knife is given to ILY A.
Clippings 5 & 6. 22:47:19 Staff 2 walks into the
doorway of the kitchen and back out. 22:51:00 Staff 1
walks into the kitchen and immediately to the
stove where there is a pot. He empties the contents of the
pot in the sink.
22:48:03 Staff 2 walks upstairs where the youth's
bedrooms are. She knocks on one door, but after no
answer, knocks on another door (ILY A's). Staff 2
has her phone out and when the door is answered, she
shows the phone to whoever is at the door (unknown which
youth she's talking to due to the camera angle). There
appears to be some sort of discussion happening via the
translator app as observed through Staff 2 showing her
phone to the youth a few times. Staff 2’s body language
does not suggest any emotions. The interaction seems
transactional and calm. 22:49:27 Staff 2 walks away and
goes back downstairs.
Clipping 7. 22:49:57 Staff 1 walks into the youth's
bedroom hallway and approaches ILY A's door. There
isn't anything in Staff 1's hands. Someone answers
the door, and Staff 1 is observed pointing toward
the stairs and seems to be gesturing while talking to the
youth to come downstairs. 22:50:16 Staff 1 puts his
body into the bedroom doorway as staff 2 comes
upstairs and walks toward the bedroom. She doesn't say
anything. 22:50:22 Staff 2 turns and goes downstairs,
and Staff 1 follows her. 10:53:30 ILY A went
into the kitchen to find the food was thrown away, but did
not have any additional/concerning interactions with Staff 1.
• The video did not show anyone pointing a knife at anyone.
• ILY A did have an audio recording he took of Staff 1 using
inappropriate language towards ILY A. The phone
recording had the following information on it:
o ILY A was heard saying to Staff 1,” repeat what you
said to me. Staff 1 stated, “you wanna play with
12

me? Don’t play with me, get the fuck out of here
before I kill your ass, I will slice your shit, stop
playing with me, don’t ever threaten me, I never did
anything to your motherfucking ass.” ILY A was
asked if there were any other incidents at Holy Cross
that made him feel unsafe or uncomfortable. ILY A
said no, that was all.
• It is noted ILY A took the audio recording and confirmed he
recorded Staff 1 speaking inappropriately to him. When
MDHHS Worker repeated this information to Staff 1, he did
not directly admit to any of the statements being made.
Staff 1 stated, "I admit to having a heated exchange with
ILY A, I have never had issues with any youth where I
would be thrown off my square like that.” Staff 1 stated he
had no intent behind his words and that he does not have
anything against ILY A. Staff 1 continued by stating he was
always willing to help when needed.
.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
ILY A and ILY D’s MiSACWIS case records were reviewed which
showed:
